messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MOONFLOWER BLOOMED!  and a mystery flower
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, My first thought was that it was related to the surprise lilies we have here in Ohio, although ours are usually a nice soft pink.  They are also known
messages.messageBody:
Sandra,

My first thought was that it was related to the surprise lilies we have here
in Ohio, although ours are usually a nice soft pink. They are also known as
naked ladies because the greenery grows and then dies back in the spring.
The flowers come up all alone in late summer or early fall. Check this out:
http://www.plantdelights.com/Catalog/Current/Detail/04054.html

HTH,
Marjorie

-----Original Message-----
From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
SandraDodd@...
Sent: Thursday, September 08, 2005 11:57 PM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] MOONFLOWER BLOOMED! and a mystery flower

I need help identifying a flower that doesn't look like it will last long,
and the first of the moonflower blooms is out tonight.

http://sandradodd.blogspot.com/

Sandra
